text.p: The following are the reports carried by Estonia's newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- Parliament amended the criminal code to introduce a 25-year and life prison sentence. Formerly 15 years was the maximum prison sentence.
- Cards that authorise the donation of vital organs will be published in the first quarter of 1997.
- The Reform Party lost four percent and the Centre Party, Pro Patria and Coalition Party each gained two percent in support since October, December polls showed.
- The Russian Duma is prepared to ratify the border agreement with Estonia, chairman Gennadi Zeleznyov and the leader of the communists faction Gennadi Zyuganov said.
- There will be no Russian faction in Riigikogu in future. Two of its six members announced their decision to become independent MPs.
- German firm Goldschmidt AG will cover the 1.2 million kroon costs of disposing of its hazardous waste, smuggled to Estonia from Germany by another firm.
- The Tallinn Department store is expanding to south Estonia, having bought 51 percent of the Tartu department Store shares.
